body.p: rabbitmq-users is the group for discussions about RabbitMQ. Once you join you can get help with technical issues, ask questions and share your experiences with RabbitMQ.
Feel free to join our community-driven RabbitMQ Slack channel.
RabbitMQ is on twitter. If you're tweeting about RabbitMQ please don't forget to use the #rabbitmq hash tag.
RabbitMQ IRC channel is #rabbitmq on irc.freenode.net: #rabbitmq -- irc://irc.freenode.net/rabbitmq. There's a Web interface to Freenode if you don't have an IRC client installed.
Please use security@rabbitmq.com for responsible disclosure of security-related issues.

To contact the team privately, please email on info@rabbitmq.com. Please note that this should only be used for things that need to be discussed in private; if you want to ask a question about how to use RabbitMQ please use rabbitmq-users instead.

For enquiries about Pivotal’s commercial licensing and support, there is information about offerings, subscription fees, and a contact form on this page. Alternatively, if you already have a support contract established with Pivotal, please see the Pivotal support page. For questions about booking training or consulting, please contact the appropriate vendor.
If you have questions about how to use RabbitMQ and do not want to purchase a support contract or learn about commercial offerings, please use the RabbitMQ mailing list instead.
